text: Madame is a 2017 French comedy-drama film directed by Amanda Sthers. The film is a satire of the class divide in today's Paris. ==Plot== Anne and Bob, an American couple living in Paris, organize a dinner party and invite twelve friends. Bob's son arrives by surprise and the total number of guests is now 13. The superstitious Anne asks her maid, Maria, to pretend to be a rich Spanish friend and join the table. Maria meets David, a British aristocrat. They both like each other and continue their relationship. ==Cast== * Harvey Keitel as Bob Fredericks * Toni Collette as Anne Fredericks * Rossy de Palma as Maria * Michael Smiley as David Morgan * Brendan Patricks as Toby * Sonia Rolland * Stanislas Merhar as Antoine Bernard * Sue Cann as Mandy * Tom Hughes as Steven Fredericks * Joséphine de La Baume as Fanny * Ginnie Watson as Jane Millerton * Tim Fellingham as Michael * Violaine Gillibert as Hélène Bernard * Alex Vizorek as Jacques * Ariane Seguillon as Josiane * Salomé Partouche as Gabriella ==Production== The film started shooting in Paris on 20 July 2016 for six weeks. ==Reception== On review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, the film has an approval rating of 44% based on 36 reviews, and an average rating of 5.42/10. The website's critics consensus reads: "Madames retrograde trappings are further weighted down by unlikable characters and an overall inability to do justice to its themes."
